article_node.title: Ukraine’s drone pilots are ‘killing for points’ as war becomes gamified
article_node.summary: Ukraine’s military has introduced a score‑based system called Brave1, where drone pilots earn points for eliminating enemy soldiers to purchase new drones. The platform rewards points most heavily for infantry kills, encouraging pilots to target manpower. Brigades can use accumulated points to buy equipment, turning procurement into a gamified process. The initiative, dubbed the world’s first military Amazon, raises ethical questions about the commodification of warfare.
